clinical_study.brief_title: Sofosbuvir With Pegylated Interferon and Ribavirin Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) Genotypes 1,4,5,6
clinical_study.official_title: The ATOMIC Study: A Multicenter, Open-label, Randomized, Duration Finding Study to Investigate the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics Following Oral Administration of PSI-7977 in Combination With Pegylated Interferon and Ribavirin in Treatment-Naive Patients With Chronic HCV Infection Genotype 1,4, 5, or 6

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the safety, tolerability, and efficacy of sofosbuvir (GS-7977; PSI-7977) administered in combination with pegylated interferon and ribavirin (PEG/RBV) in treatment-naive patients with HCV genotypes 1,4,5,6, or indeterminate genotype.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Sustained Virologic Response 24 Weeks Following Completion of Treatment (SVR24)
primary_outcome.description: SVR24 was defined as HCV RNA < the limit of detection (LOD; < 15 IU/mL) 24 weeks after the last dose of study drug.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Experienced Adverse Events
primary_outcome.description: Adverse events (AEs) occurring from baseline (Day 1 for all groups) to 30 days following the last dose of study drug were summarized across the participant population. A participant was counted once if they had a qualifying event.

secondary_outcome.description: SVR12 was defined as HCV RNA < LOD 12 weeks after the last dose of study drug.

intervention.description: Sofosbuvir (SOF) administered as a 400 mg tablet orally once daily
Ribavirin (RBV) tablets administered orally in a divided daily dose according to package insert weight-based dosing recommendations (< 75kg = 1000 mg and ≥ 75 kg = 1200 mg)
Pegylated interferon alfa-2a (PEG) 180 μg administered once weekly by subcutaneous injection

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Males and females with Chronic Hepatitis C (HCV) Genotype 1,4,5,6, or indeterminate
- Naive to previous HCV treatment
Exclusion Criteria:
- Positive for HBsAg, anti-HBc IgM Ab, or anti-HIV Ab
- History of any other clinically significant chronic liver disease

analysis.groups_desc: The analyses was stratified by IL28B (CC versus any T allele) and plasma HCV RNA (< 800,000 IU/mL versus ≥ 800,000 IU/mL). Only participants with genotype 1 were included in the comparison due to the fact that participants with genotype 4 and 6 were only enrolled in the SOF+PEG+RBV 24 weeks group.
analysis.p_value_desc: The p-value is based on the Cochran-Mantel-Haenszel (CMH) test stratified by randomization stratification factors.
analysis.estimate_desc: The difference in proportions and its 95% confidence interval (CI) were calculated based on stratum-adjusted Mantel-Haenszel (MH) proportions.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Virologic Failure Following Treatment (Viral Relapse).
measure.description: Viral relapse was defined as HCV RNA < 15 IU/mL at end of treatment, confirmed with 2 consecutive values or last available measurement.
measure.population: Participants in the Safety Analysis Set with available data were analyzed.

reported_events.time_frame: Baseline (Day 1) to Week 12 or Week 24 (depending upon treatment arm) plus 30 days. Adverse events are counted if they began on or after the date of the first dose and on or before the last dose of study drug plus 30 days.
reported_events.desc: As prespecified in the analysis plan, adverse events are reported according to the group to which participants were initially randomized.
